Because most of the time, people inexperienced with a Champion won't perform well. When you go into ranked, the expectation is that you are playing your best and pulling out your most experienced picks. Someone picking a Champion for the first time, on average, is going to under-perform compared to someone who has hundreds of games on the same Champion. 

And maybe it worked out for you, but I would say statistically speaking, it doesn't work out more often than it does. 

People want to win in ranked, and having teammates experienced with their Champions is going to help that. That's why people don't want others first timing Champions in ranked.

I think knowledge is just as important as "experience" when it comes to this game, though. If you do your research, you will more than likely outperform anybody who's had even 20 games with the champion.

> I think knowledge is just as important as "experience" when it comes to this game, though.
